pmhal_lp8733.c File Reference

Power Management IC - LP8733 specific API implementation. APIs are exported by using function pointers. More...

#include <stdint.h>
#include <stddef.h>
#include <ti/csl/hw_types.h>
#include "pm_types.h"
#include "pm_utils.h"
#include "pmhal_pmic.h"
#include <ti/drv/pm/include/pmic/pmhal_lp8733.h>
#include "pmhal_pmicComm.h"
#include "pmhal_prcm.h"

Macros

#define PMHAL_LP8733_BUCK_STEP_VOLTAGE_RANGE1   (100U)
 Output voltage step for the Buck regulator for the output voltage between 0.7 V - 0.73 V, 10 mV steps. Step voltage in 10^ (-4) V.
 
#define PMHAL_LP8733_BUCK_STEP_VOLTAGE_RANGE2   (50U)
 Output voltage step for the Buck regulator for the output voltage between 0.73 V - 1.4 V, 5 mV steps. Step voltage in 10^ (-4) V.
 
#define PMHAL_LP8733_BUCK_STEP_VOLTAGE_RANGE3   (200U)
 Output voltage step for the Buck regulator for the output voltage between 1.4 V - 3.36 V, 20 mV steps. Step voltage in 10^ (-4) V.
 
#define PMHAL_LP8733_BUCK_RANGE1_MIN_VOLTAGE   (7000U)
 Output voltage minimum and maximum values for Buck Regulators Range 1: 0.7 V - 0.73 V.
 
#define PMHAL_LP8733_BUCK_RANGE1_MIN_VSEL   (0x14U)
 Minimum and Maximum value of VSEL for Range 1.
 
#define PMHAL_LP8733_BUCK_RANGE2_MIN_VOLTAGE   (7350U)
 Output voltage minimum and maximum values for Buck Regulators Range 2: 0.735 V - 1.4 V.
 
#define PMHAL_LP8733_BUCK_RANGE2_MIN_VSEL   (0x18U)
 Minimum and Maximum value of VSEL for Range 2.
 
#define PMHAL_LP8733_BUCK_RANGE3_MIN_VOLTAGE   (14200U)
 Output voltage minimum and maximum values for Buck Regulators Range 3: 1.42 V - 3.36 V.
 
#define PMHAL_LP8733_BUCK_RANGE3_MIN_VSEL   (0x9EU)
 Minimum and Maximum value of VSEL for Range 3.
 
#define PMHAL_LP8733_LDO_STEP_VOLTAGE   (1000U)
 Output voltage step for the LDO regulator.

void PMHALLP8733ConfigureRegulatorMap (pmhalLP8733RegulatorMapPtr_t regulatorMap)
 The PMIC regulator output to the device input mapping can be different on different boards. This API can be used to provide a different mapping to the PMIC driver if the mapping does not

match the default. Example table is shown below:

| Device voltage Rail | Ptr to Regulator |

| PMHAL_PRCM_PMIC_REGULATOR_CORE | PMHAL_LP8733_REGULATOR_BUCK2 | | PMHAL_PRCM_PMIC_REGULATOR_DSPEVE| PMHAL_LP8733_REGULATOR_BUCK1 | | .... | | index (Refer | For index of the | | pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t) | gPmhalLP8733Regulator | | | refer |

| | #pmhalLP8733RegulatorId_t |

This table when translated to code is as below: pmhalLP8733RegulatorMap_t regulatorMap[ PMHAL_PRCM_PMIC_REGULATOR_COUNT] = { { &gPmhalLP8733Regulator[PMHAL_LP8733_REGULATOR_BUCK1], I2C_INSTANCE, PMIC_I2C_SLAVE_ADDRESS }, { &gPmhalLP8733Regulator[PMHAL_LP8733_REGULATOR_BUCK2], I2C_INSTANCE, PMIC_I2C_SLAVE_ADDRESS }, ...... };. More...
 

Variables

const pmhalLP8733RegulatorProp_t gPmhalLP8733Regulator [PMHAL_LP8733_REGULATOR_MAX]
 

Detailed Description

Power Management IC - LP8733 specific API implementation. APIs are exported by using function pointers.

Function Documentation

static uint32_t PmhalLP8733CheckRegulatorEnabled ( pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t  regId)
static

Is the given regulator enabled? This utility function must only be called by functions in this file and the caller must ensure that the PMIC communication is configured and enabled before calling this function.

Parameters
regIdRegulator Id. Refer Enum pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t
Returns
TRUE if regulator is enabled; FALSE otherwise.
void PMHALLP8733ConfigureRegulatorMap ( pmhalLP8733RegulatorMapPtr_t  regulatorMap)

The PMIC regulator output to the device input mapping can be different on different boards. This API can be used to provide a different mapping to the PMIC driver if the mapping does not

match the default. Example table is shown below:

| Device voltage Rail | Ptr to Regulator |

| PMHAL_PRCM_PMIC_REGULATOR_CORE | PMHAL_LP8733_REGULATOR_BUCK2 | | PMHAL_PRCM_PMIC_REGULATOR_DSPEVE| PMHAL_LP8733_REGULATOR_BUCK1 | | .... | | index (Refer | For index of the | | pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t) | gPmhalLP8733Regulator | | | refer |

| | #pmhalLP8733RegulatorId_t |

This table when translated to code is as below: pmhalLP8733RegulatorMap_t regulatorMap[ PMHAL_PRCM_PMIC_REGULATOR_COUNT] = { { &gPmhalLP8733Regulator[PMHAL_LP8733_REGULATOR_BUCK1], I2C_INSTANCE, PMIC_I2C_SLAVE_ADDRESS }, { &gPmhalLP8733Regulator[PMHAL_LP8733_REGULATOR_BUCK2], I2C_INSTANCE, PMIC_I2C_SLAVE_ADDRESS }, ...... };.

Parameters
regulatorMapPointer to the array of pointers which gives the mapping. The array is defined as above.
Returns
None
static pmErrCode_t PMHALLP8733DisableRegulator ( pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t  regId)
static

Disable the given regulator. The declaration is present here to ensure this function is used only via function pointer.

Parameters
regIdRegulator Id. Refer Enum pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t
Returns
status PM_SUCCESS if API is a success. PM_BADARGS/FAIL otherwise.
static pmErrCode_t PMHALLP8733EnableRegulator ( pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t  regId)

Parameters

Returns
status PM_SUCCESS if API is a success. PM_BADARGS/FAIL otherwise.
const pmhalPmicOperations_t* PMHALLP8733GetPMICOps ( void  )

Get PMIC ops structure. All the other functions are accessed via function pointers whose array is exported by this function.

Returns
Return pointer to the PMIC ops structure.
static pmErrCode_t PMHALLP8733GetProductId ( uint32_t *  productId)
static

Return the PMIC Product ID. The declaration is present here to ensure this function is used only via function pointer.

Parameters
productIdThe Product ID is populated in this parameter.
Returns
status PM_SUCCESS if API is a success. PM_BADARGS otherwise.
static uint32_t PMHALLP8733GetRegulatorConvVoltage ( pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t  regId,
uint32_t  avsVoltage 
)
static

Return the Regulator Step voltage size. This is required by the voltage manager to understand the opp for the given voltage set for the given voltage rail.

Parameters
regIdRegulator ID. Refer pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t for details.
avsVoltageAVS voltage which is to be converted to regulator voltage
Returns
convVolt The voltage that would be supplied by the regulator if the AVS voltage is given to the API. NOTE: This API does not program the PMIC. It just returns the calculated value of AVS voltage converted to PMIC voltage based on the PMIC voltage resolution.
static pmErrCode_t PMHALLP8733GetRegulatorVoltage ( pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t  regId,
uint32_t *  voltage 
)
static

Get the voltage setting of the given regulator. The declaration is present here to ensure this function is used only via function pointer.

Parameters
regIdRegulator Id. Refer Enum pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t
voltageVoltage in mV returned.
Returns
status PM_SUCCESS if API is a success. PM_BADARGS otherwise.
static const char * PMHALLP8733GetRevision ( void  )
static

Get the LP8733 PMIC chip revision. The declaration is present here to ensure this function is used only via function pointer.

Parameters
void
Returns
revString - The revision. "INVALID" is returned in case of error.

static

Return the PMIC Vendor ID. The declaration is present here to ensure this function is used only via function pointer.

Parameters
vendorIdThe Vendor ID is populated in this parameter.
Returns
status PM_SUCCESS if API is a success. PM_BADARGS otherwise.
static pmErrCode_t PMHALLP8733IsPresent ( void  )
static

Check if the LP8733 PMIC is present. The declaration is present here to ensure this function is used only via function pointer.

Parameters
void
Returns
PM_SUCCESS - LP8733 PMIC is present. PM_PMHAL_PMIC_VENDOR_ID_INVALID - PMIC vendor id doesn't match the expected value. PM_PMHAL_PMIC_PRODUCT_ID_INVALID - PMIC product id doesn't match the expected value.
static uint32_t PMHALLP8733IsRegulatorEnabled ( pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t  regId)
static

API to check if the given regulator enabled. The declaration is present here to ensure this function is used only via function pointer.

Parameters
regIdRegulator Id. Refer Enum pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t
Returns
enabled TRUE if regulator is enabled; FALSE otherwise.
static pmErrCode_t PmhalLP8733ReadPhyAddr ( uint8_t  i2cNumber,
uint8_t  slaveAddr,
uint32_t  phyAddr,
uint32_t *  value 
)
static

Read the register value at the given physical address.

Parameters
i2cNumberThe PMIC chip number to which the voltage regulator is connected.
slaveAddrThe I2C PMIC Slave address.
phyAddrAddress to be read.
valueReturns the value read.
Returns
status Return PM_SUCCESS if read is successful. Else returns PM_FAIL.
static pmErrCode_t PMHALLP8733SetRegulatorVoltage ( pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t  regId,
uint32_t  voltage,
uint32_t  timeout 
)
static

Set the voltage of the regulator to the mV given. The declaration is present here to ensure this function is used only via function pointer.

Parameters
regIdRegulator Id. Refer Enum pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t for more details.
voltageVoltage in mV returned.
timeoutTimeout iterations to wait for setting the right regulator voltage value. Possible values can be: PM_TIMEOUT_NOWAIT Do not wait for voltage setting. PM_TIMEOUT_INFINITE Wait infinitely till the voltage is set. Non Zero Value Wait for the time provided by the user.
Returns
Status PM_SUCCESS if API is a success. PM_BADARGS otherwise.
static pmErrCode_t PmhalLP8733VoltageToVselOffset ( pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t  regId,
uint32_t  voltage,
uint32_t *  vsel 
)
static

Given voltage in mV and range, return the VSEL offset.

Parameters
regIdRegulator Id. Refer Enum pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t
voltageVoltage in mV.
vselVSEL value returned.
Returns
status
static uint32_t PmhalLP8733VselOffsetToVoltage ( pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t  regId,
uint32_t  vsel 
)
static

Given VSEL offset convert it to voltage in mV and return.

Parameters
regIdRegulator Id. Refer Enum pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t
vselVSEL value returned.
Returns
voltage Voltage in mV.
static pmErrCode_t PmhalLP8733WritePhyAddr ( uint8_t  i2cNumber,
uint8_t  slaveAddr,
uint32_t  phyAddr,
uint32_t  value 
)
static

Write the given register value at the given physical address.

Parameters
i2cNumberThe I2C number used on the board to connect to the desired PMIC.
slaveAddrThe I2C PMIC Slave address.
phyAddrAddress to be written to.
valueReturns the value to be written.
Returns
Return success or failure.

Variable Documentation

const pmhalLP8733RegulatorProp_t gPmhalLP8733Regulator[PMHAL_LP8733_REGULATOR_MAX]

Data structure to describe the regulator for all the regulators.
